brand_info.brand_name: Luxury French chocolate by Le Chocolat Alain Ducasse | Online shop
brand_info.brand_description:
A CHOCOLATEY FLUTTER
Discover the enchanted aviary now housed at the Manufacture. Peacocks, Ducks, Geese and Woodpeckers have built their nests and laid their fascinatingly shaped and intensely flavoured eggs. Look carefully and embark on a journey of discovery amidst a colourful landscape.


All chocolate, dried fruit mendiants, almond, hazelnut or coconut praline, the Manufacture whisks you away with its exclusive Easter creations. Perfect for bringing all ages together to indulge in delicious treats.

products.name: HIDE-AND-SEEK BOX 75% Dark & 45% Milk Chocolate
products.consume_advice: At its most delicious within 6 weeks of purchase

products.allergens: All our products may contain traces of milk, eggs, gluten, nuts, peanuts, sesame and soya.
products.description: Inside this playful and elegant box, you'll find eight hexa-birds to slip each into their packet (using the supplied pair of gloves) before hiding them inside or outside for an unforgettable Easter Flight. Ducks, geese, woodpeckers and peacocks in dark, milk and mendiant chocolate fly away: it's up to you to find them ! And don’t forget, the early bird catches the worm, so hurry! Ingredients Fèves de cacao (Equateur, Madagascar, Pérou, Sao Tomé, Sumba), sucre de canne, beurre de cacao, AMANDES (8%), NOISETTES (8%), LAIT en poudre, eau, émulsifiant: lécithine de tournesol, fleur de sel. Nutritional values (pour 100g): Valeur énergétique: 2327kJ/560kcal; Matières grasses: 38g (dont acides gras saturés: 21g); Glucides: 38g (dont sucres: 33g); Protéines: 13g; Sel: 0,18g. products.description: The birds have flown away, but not before leaving an unexpected and delicious Easter gift in their nest. Inside this lovely box: the promise of a wonderful praliné tasting! 4 eggs in their shells, to be peeled to discover their recipe: almond, coconut, hazelnut and cocoa nibs, our old-fashioned pralinés are on parade! Ingredients Almonds, Hazelnuts, Cocoa beans (Peru, Madagascar, Sao Tome, Ecuador), Cocoa butter, Coconut, Crêpe dentelle (Wheat, sugar, Butter (Milk), Sunflower oil, Milk (France), Barley malt, salt), water, Milk (France), Flower of salt, sunflower lecithin. products.consume_advice: At its most delicious within 6 weeks of purchase
products.subtitle: 12 Praliné Easter Treats
products.description: BEHIND THE SCENES AT THE MANUFACTURE Discover the secrets behind the creation of this Lamb, whose fine details require all the more delicacy when handling the chocolate at each stage. Our Signature Blend 75% dark chocolate is first tempered before being poured into a mold, with its finely chiseled lines, and spread with a brush. It is then crystallized, giving it a brilliant color and allowing it to be unmolded more quickly. Before sealing the two shells, praliné treats are placed inside, to the delight of those who will discover them! Our Lamb is as irresistible on the inside as it is on the outside! All our creations are handcrafted in Paris, from the cocoa bean to the chocolate bonbon.

products.description: BEHIND THE SCENES AT THE MANUFACTURE The signature Easter Egg never ceases to amaze with its shape, which gives the impression of perpetual movement. A creation designed as a tribute to the family of chef Alain Ducasse, grandson of a carpenter. The secret of this unique shape? The hand. The hand of the artist, who designs and creates the mould for the Turned Egg. And the craftsman's hand, both quick and patient, to work the chocolate in harmony with the many facets of its precious template. An exclusive design by Pierre Tachon - Soins Graphiques. All our creations are handcrafted in Paris, from the cocoa bean to the chocolate bonbon.

products.description: DISCOVER THE MANUFACTURING STEPS OF OUR FAMOUS PÉPITES. Discover the secret of the Manufacture's signature recipe , and learn more about the work of our artisan chocolatiers! Roasted and caramelized before being blended to create the perfect texture , the old-fashioned praliné that makes up our delicious Pépites is prepared from rigorously selected ingredients , for an unbeatable taste . Kenya coffee, hazelnut, buckwheat or walnut, these creamy praline recipes are then deposited in the heart of a crunchy chocolate, either 75% dark Assemblage Signature, or 45% milk Madagascar, for a delightful tasting experience . All in all, it takes ten or so steps to mold our pépites , not counting the chocolate and praliné making. All our creations are handmade in Paris, from the cocoa bean to the chocolate bonbon.

products.description: Discover the manufacturing steps of the Coconut praliné chocolate bar The unique coconut praliné of our chocolate craftsmen slips into our filled bars ! This praliné with coconut shavings and roasted almonds is prepared in our manufacture in Paris. A coconut cream caramel is also made separately. The dark chocolate is then assembled: the chocolate is first finely poured. A layer of coconut cream caramel is poached, then covered with a generous layer of coconut praliné . Finally, a layer of melted chocolate covers the whole. When tasted, the roundness of the coconut balances the intensity and tangy notes of the Signature Blend 75% dark chocolate. Crunchy praliné, creamy caramel and crunchy chocolate... a symphony of textures and flavors for a truly gourmet moment !

products.description: Let's bake! Chef Alain Ducasse gives you his recipe for the perfect crêpes to go with our hazelnut and peanut spreads. For about 10 crêpes, You will need: 100g flour 10g caster sugar 1 pinch of salt 1 egg 25cl milk 25g melted butter 5g oil 1 orange zest lemon zest clarified butter. Sift the flour and add the sugar. Beat the eggs with the salt. Gently pour them over the flour, stir until the mixture is smooth. Pour in the milk little by little, stirring constantly. Then add the melted butter and oil. Finally grate in the orange and lemon peel. Leave the batter to rest for 2 hours in the fridge. Cook the crêpes in a non-stick pan greased with clarified butter. 3,2,1 Spread! *Clarified butter is more resitant to high temperatures. To obtain it, melt soft butter, remove the white foam at the surface, then filter.
